# Programação em Python {.unnumbered}
![](images\python.jpg) ## A template to write books ready for self-publishing Go to [https://github.com/b-rodrigues/kdp_quarto](https://github.com/b-rodrigues/kdp_quarto) for the source code. Go to [https://b-rodrigues.github.io/kdp_quarto/](https://b-rodrigues.github.io/kdp_quarto/) to visit the published website. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} a very long line of R code that wraps in html, epub and PDF! In a pdf especially this is needed ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data(mtcars) lm(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = mpg ~ ., data = mtcars) Coefficients: (Intercept) cyl disp hp drat wt 12.30337 -0.11144 0.01334 -0.02148 0.78711 -3.71530 qsec vs am gear carb 0.82104 0.31776 2.52023 0.65541 -0.19942 ``` ::: ::: This is how you can show verbatim code chunks in the output. This is using a `{verbatim}` chunk (check the source `index.qmd`): ````default ```{r} a very long line of R code that wraps in html, epub and PDF! In a pdf especially this is needed ``` ```` If you want to show the triple backticks inline, you can also do so, like this: ```` ```{r} ```` to start an R chunk and ```` ``` ```` to end it. Check the source. ## Figures Use `knitr::include_graphics()` to include images. Check the source for how to add labels and captions: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::include_graphics("images/nda.png") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![NDA logo](images/nda.png){#fig-nda width=261} ::: ::: See @fig-nda for a logo. ## Conditional content The block below does not appear in the PDF, only on the website and Epub: ::: {.content-hidden when-format="pdf"} Hello, I won't appear in the PDF! ::: ::: {.content-visible when-format="pdf"} But this text here, will only appear in the PDF! :::
